intro: Koyamacalia maekawae, commonly known as the Hawaiian red hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Maui in Hawaii. It is characterized by its striking red flowers, which bloom throughout the summer months. The plant has large, heart-shaped leaves with a waxy texture and a deep green color. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it well-suited to tropical climates. The botanical features of Koyamacalia maekawae make it a distinctive and ornamental species in its native habitat.
